sub_title: PHD Student at Delft University of Technology
summary:
I am honored to be employed at the Dept. of Electrical Engineering and Information Technology (DTETI), Faculty of Engineering, UGM as a junior lecturer. I currently take a 4-year academic leave to pursue my Ph.D. degree at the Delft University of Technology. My main task was leading a team of 5 master students in conducting research on content filtering, a project funded by Ministry of Communication and Information of Republic of Indonesia. I also had the opportunity to organize several academic conferences and seminars, held by DTETI UGM.

My main passion is conducting research in the area of Geometry Processing, specifically in reduced method to allow interactive processing and analysis of surface information (functions, vector fields, n-RoSy fields, or tensor fields) in generously tesselated polygon mesh. 

Previously, I obtained my undergraduate degree in Information technology at Universitas Gadjah Mada. I then went to South Korea to pursue my master degree in 3D Modeling and Processing group at Seoul National University (Seoul), where I have the honor to learn and be supervised by Prof. Kim Myung-Soo. 
 
Outside of my academic life, I like to contribute to society and to inspire others. I was Secretary-General of IMUSKA and KMI South Korea (both are Indonesian organizations in South Korea). I also frequently give motivational and inspiring talks in student events, held by numerous universities within and outside Yogyakarta.

projects.title: Visualization of Child Mortality
projects.description: It is a multi-dimensional data representation and analysis of how various factors contribute to cause high number of child mortality in Indonesia.

contributors.headline: Academic Faculty at Universitas Gadjah Mada
PHD Student at Delft University of Technology

projects.title: Content Filtering
projects.description: It is a project funded by Ministry of Communication and Informatics (KOMINFO) with main function of blocking negative content on the web. Our system is implemented in both proxy server and Android phone.

contributors.headline: PHD Student at Delft University of Technology

projects.title: Student World Forum 2011 in Chulalongkorn University, Thailand
projects.description: I participated in Student World Forum 2011 organized by AC21. The event was in Chulalongkorn University, Bangkok, Thailand.

contributors.headline: PHD Student at Delft University of Technology

projects.title: 3D Printing of Deformable Objects
projects.description: I created multiple types of deformable objects using sweep surface modeling with B-Splines as the guiding curve. The sweep-surface was then rendered and tessellated using triangular polygon mesh. I employed multiple couplings and joints to add more degrees of freedom (DOI) to the model. The design was then 3D Printed using Stratasys’ Objet Printer.

contributors.headline: PHD Student at Delft University of Technology

projects.title: Observation of Data Structure for Multiple Traveling Salesman Problem (mTSP)
projects.description: Using relatively newly-developed TSP algorithm, we observed the potential to extend for the mTSP. We designed several operations that we thought are important to be supported on mTSP and implemented them in C++ environment.

contributors.headline: PHD Student at Delft University of Technology

projects.title: Development of Institutional Website for Department of Civil Engineering, UMY
projects.description: We developed an Information System for Department of Civil Engineering, Universitas Muhammadiyah Yogyakarta (UMY).

contributors.headline: PHD Student at Delft University of Technology
Academic Faculty at Universitas Gadjah Mada

projects.title: Simulation of UAVs Autonomously Approaching Certain Target Using Dubin’s Algorithm
projects.description: Working together with graduate student of EEIT, I was in charge of developing the implementation of Dubin’s Algorithm on Blender environment. Using Blender’s python programming capability we implemented the simulation and then analyzed the results using Scilab.

contributors.headline: PHD Student at Delft University of Technology

projects.title: Web-based Application Research on Insect Identification for Entomology
projects.description: We were a team of 5 members, combination of students from EEIT (3) and Faculty of Biology (2), to design interactive web-based taxonomical classification of insect. Given the taxonomy of insects, I was the main developer for the web application using Yii framework

contributors.headline: PHD Student at Delft University of Technology
Assistant Professor (Data Science) at Monash University Indonesia

projects.title: Development of Information System for Psychological Consultation Unit (UKP) of Faculty of Psychology, UGM
projects.description: Upon request of Psychological Consultation Unit (UKP), we developed paperless office system (part of information system) in order to help them manage their documents and clients better. The system was Microsoft-based and was developed in Visual Studio.

courses.name: Advanced Human Computer Interaction: Information Visualization

profile_positions.description: My research interest is in Computer Graphics, particularly in the area of Geometry Modeling. My team is currently working on Spectral Methods for Geometry Modeling. In addition, I also have interest in Machine Learning, Parallel Processing, and  Medical Imaging.
profile_positions.title: PHD Student

company.name: Dept. of Electrical Engineering and Information Technology, Faculty of Engineering, UGM

profile_positions.location: Jl. Grafika No.2, Kampus UGM, Yogyakarta 55281
profile_positions.company: Dept. of Electrical Engineering and Information Technology, Faculty of Engineering, UGM
profile_positions.description:
My focus of research mainly on the area of Computer Graphics and Geometry Modeling. I teach several introductory courses, such as:
(a) Fundamental Programming, 
(b) Operating Systems, 
(c) Game Development, and 
(d) Academic Writing. 
I am also in charge of some tutorial, including (a) Engineering Mathematics, (b) Numerical Methods and (c) Engineering Physics.
profile_positions.title: Lecturer

profile_positions.company: Dept. of Electrical Engineering and Information Technology, Faculty of Engineering, UGM
profile_positions.description: I serve as Research Assistant at Department of Electrical Engineering and Information Technology, Faculty of Engineering, Universitas Gadjah Mada (UGM). My main task is leading a team of 4 in conducting research on content filtering, a project funded by Ministry of Communication and Informatics (KOMINFO). In addition, I also assist the Department in organizing academic seminars and conferences, such as Post-Graduate Symposium and International Conference on Information Technology and Electrical Engineering (ICITEE).
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

profile_positions.description: I was the Secretary General of IMUSKA (Indonesian Muslim Students Association in South Korea) whose main task is organizing activities for Indonesian students in South Korea. We held both fun and educating activities such as breaking the fast in different cities in South Korea (e.g. Gwangju, Daegu, Seoul, Suwon, etc.).
profile_positions.title: Secretary General

profile_positions.description: For about one-and-half-years, I was part of PPLN Seoul, South Korea whose main task is organizing Indonesian General Election (Legislative and Executives [PEMILU]) for about 32.600 Indonesians Residing in South Korea. My main responsibility was organizing socialization in various cities, setting publications mechanism and documenting events during preparation and organization of the General Election.
profile_positions.title: Member of PPLN Seoul

profile_positions.description: I was serving as Secretary General of Indonesia Muslim Community in South Korea (KMI) in the period of 2013 to 2014. My main role is making sure that the policy of Chairman of the Community and Board of Advisory is well implemented by the staffs.
profile_positions.title: Secretary General

company.name: Department of Electrical Engineering and Information Technology - Universitas Gadjah Mada

profile_positions.description: I assist the lecturers in delivering their courses, in which sometimes I substitute the lecturers to teach or help them in giving credits for exams.
profile_positions.title: Teaching Assistant

profile_positions.description: I was an intern at UN-APCICT for about 2 months. The program was a cooperation between Daejeon University, UN-APCICT and AUN (ASEAN University Networks), in which 7 students from 7 different ASEAN countries did internship in UN-APCICT. My main task was evaluating AVA (APCICT Virtual Academy) and conducting case study on ICT for development in Indonesia.
profile_positions.title: Intern Student

volunteer_experiences.description: I teach basic computer to Indonesian migrant workers in Daegu, South Korea, so that they have the familiarity to use computer programs in conducting their business after going back to Indonesia.

I was responsible to organize classes and activities for homeless children in Timoho, Yogyakarta. Under supervision of Ministry of Social Affairs of UGM Students Body (BEM KM) we organized various events (reading, game playing, site visit, etc) for the homeless kids.
I was assisting pregnant women and newly-delivering mothers during their stay in refugee camp after the eruption of Mount Merapi in 2010.
